alert.note: Alert for Bourbon; Harrison; Scott (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 01 at 5:13AM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of EAST CENTRAL Kentucky, including the following counties, Bourbon, Harrison KY and Scott KY. * WHEN...Until 815 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 512 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Georgetown, Stamping Ground, Sadieville, Rogers Gap, Muddy Ford, Boydtown, Moon Lake Estates, Delaplain, Mallard Point and Oxford. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
